common_errors.error_pattern: Could not connect to Redis at.*Connection refused
common_errors.cause: Redis server not running or listening on different host/port
common_errors.solution: Start Redis: sudo systemctl start redis. Check bind and port in redis.conf.

common_errors.cause: Redis requires password but none provided
common_errors.solution: Use -a flag: redis-cli -a yourpassword. Or after connecting: AUTH yourpassword
Check password in redis.conf (requirepass). For ACL: verify user credentials.

common_errors.cause: Command doesn't exist, is disabled, or renamed
common_errors.solution: Check command name. Some commands disabled in redis.conf (rename-command).

common_errors.cause: ACL rule prevents this user from running this command
common_errors.solution: Update ACL to allow command: ACL SETUSER user +command. Or use admin user.

common_errors.cause: Redis is out of memory (maxmemory reached)
common_errors.solution: Free memory: delete keys, increase maxmemory, or set maxmemory-policy for eviction.

common_errors.error_pattern: LOADING Redis is loading the dataset
common_errors.cause: Redis is still loading data from disk (RDB/AOF)
common_errors.solution: Wait for loading to complete. Watch progress with INFO persistence.

common_errors.error_pattern: READONLY You can't write against a read only replica
common_errors.cause: Connected to replica, not master, for write operation
common_errors.solution: Connect to master for writes. Or enable replica writes: CONFIG SET replica-read-only no

common_errors.cause: Redis cluster is unhealthy (slots not covered)
common_errors.solution: Check cluster: CLUSTER INFO. Fix with: redis-cli --cluster fix host:port

common_errors.cause: Command called with incorrect number of arguments
common_errors.solution: Check command syntax: HELP command. Refer to redis.io/commands.
